further to amend the Export Processtng Zones Authority Ordinance, 1980
WHEREAS, it is expedient furttrer to amend the Export Processing Zones

524 THE GAZETTEOF JULY 2023
l. Short title and commencement.- (l) This Act may be called the
Export Processing Zones Authority (Amendment) Act,2023.
(2) It shall come into force at once.
2. Amendment of section 2, Ordinance IV of 1980.- In the Export
Processing Zones Author.ity Ordinance, 1980 (IV of 1980), hereinafter referred to
as the said Ordinance, in section 2,-
(a) after paragraph (d), the following new paragraph shall be inserted,
namely:-
"(da) *Export Processing Zone developer and operator" Means a
company incorporated in Pakistan which has entered into an
agreement with Authority for the development and Operations
of Private and Public Participated Export Processing Zones."
(b) for paragraph (k), the foliowing shall be substituted, namely:--
'(k) "Zone" means such ared as the Federal Government may, by
notification in tlre official Gazette, declare to be a Zone
inciuding Private and Public Participated Export Processing
Zones for the purposes of this Ordinance."
3. Insertion of section 9A, Ordinance fV of 1980.-In the said
Ordinance, after section 9, the following new section shall be inserted, namely:-
*9A. Establishment of Private and Pubtic Participated Export
Processing Zones.- (1) The Authority may, with the
approval of the Federal Government establish Private and
Public Participated Export Processing Zones:
Provided that existing industry or industries, as the case
may be, subject to fulfillment of criteria, ffiay be declared
part of a Private and Public Participated Export Pr:ocessing
Zone:
Provided f*ither that the Private and Public Participated
Lxport Processing Zones may be established in the area
contiguous to the industry or industries so declared under
sub-section (1).
(2) The Private and Public Participated Export
Processing Zones established under sub-section (l) shall
operate subject to such tenqs approved by the Federal
. Government."
TAHIR HUSSAIN,
Secretary.
